outputs.output_descr: Europe and Commonwealth of Independent States: HIV, Human Rights, Gender and Sexual Diversity

Socioeconomic  determinants and MDGs: UNDP will develop a tool targeted toward non-health ministries to forecast the sustainability and scale up of ARV treatment. The tool will incorporate estimated trends for indicators such as the number people receiving ARV treatment, cost per patient and donor funds available for treatment. The tool will be used as an advocacy piece to prepare countries where the Global Fund will soon exit and countries facing crises in providing sustainable treatment. The initiative will incorporate UNDP's work on development planning (to prepare for the shift from donor funding to domestic allocation), IP and innovative financing (to lower the cost of treatment) and Global Fund implementation (to look at government capacity and procurement to address ARV stock outs).

Strengthening the governance component of AIDS responses. Coordination and accountability: Support to UNDP Country Offices with reviews of their Country Office Programme Documents and CCA/UNDAFs. UNDP COs have request regional center support with formulation of these documents. Local HIV responses: Partnership with the BRC Capacity Development Practice on sub-national responses to HIV will continue, funded through the Country Office Support Facility. LDP and CCE: The Regional Programme will conduct the second training of the Leadership Development Programme for Positive Women, which includes women and girls living with HIV fron 7 countries in the region. The training is currently planned for Minsk 1-4 March and will include at least one policymaker per country delegation.  UNDP will also host, with UNAIDS and the Global Fund, a Besedka Dialogue Space at the Dushanbe EECAAC in October.
Monitoring and Evaluation as well as administrative costs including rent, IT equipment and support, admin services provided by UNDP Russia/Bratislava
Programme Management support for salaries and related costs
